page.title: 08Our school
page.content:
John Wheeldon First School.
The original school on this site was opened in 1895,being the first built by Stafford School Board. It took children from 5 to 14 years in classes of sixty. The first headmaster was John Wheeldon, later Mayor of Stafford.Three separate schools for boys, girls and infants later grew on the site. Mr.Wheeldon remained headmaster of the boys until 1922. The school subsequently adopted his name. Subsidence caused by old salt mine workings resulted in rebuilding of the school into a single storey primary for boys and girls in 1968. Since reorganisation four years ago we are now a First School with 281 children from 4 to 9 years.
